section.title: History of Present Illness
section.text: Essentially , Mr. Cornea is a 60 year old male who noted the onset of dark urine during early January . He underwent CT and ERCP at the Lisonatemi Faylandsburgnic, Community Hospital with a stent placement and resolution of jaundice . He underwent an ECHO and endoscopy at Ingree and Ot of Weamanshy Medical Center on April 28 . He was found to have a large , bulging , extrinsic mass in the lesser curvature of his stomach . Fine needle aspiration showed atypical cells , positively reactive mesothelial cells . Abdominal CT on April 14 , showed a 12 x 8 x 8 cm mass in the region of the left liver , and appeared to be from the lesser curvature of the stomach or left liver . He denied any nausea , vomiting , anorexia , or weight loss . He states that his color in urine or in stool is now normal .

section.title: Past Surgical History
section.text: Status post left kidney stones x2 , and he has had a parathyroid surgery .

section.title: Allergies
section.text: He has no known drug allergies

section.title: Hospital Course
section.text: Basically , patient underwent a subtotal gastrectomy on the 7th of June by Dr. Kotefooksshuff . He had an uncomplicated postoperative course and he was transferred . Advanced his diet on postop day # 4 to a transitional diet . His PCA was discontinued on postop day # 4 , and essentially he was started on his pre-op medications on the postop day # 5

section.title: Discharge Disposition
section.text: He is going to a rehabilitation facility until he is able to live independently .
